page.title: 14Sheep Farm: The Deverills
page.content: {Church Farm}is a large farm with 375 acres of land,295 acres around {Longbridge Deverill}and 8O acres at {Upton Scudamore.}Until three years ago it was a dairy farm with 25O cows, then the farmer changed to sheep farming. It is a very diverse farm. It has a flock of 4OO ewes, mule and pedigree Poll Dorset sheep. Poll Dorsets are a short-fleeced sheep,many producing twins, the average 1.8 lambs per ewe. The lambs are sold for meat and the fleece is sold after shearing. There are also 15O store Hereford cattle, 7O hens and 2 horses on the farm. Cereal crops are grown on 2OO acres of land, half wheat and half barley as fodder grain. The family has long connections with the{Deverills Football Team.}A new football pitch has just been roped off from one of the fields for next season
